summary: The U.S. Coast Guard offers child care programs to its personnel—but has only a limited number of on-base child care centers. As a result, Coast Guard families generally rely on community-based child care providers. The Coast Guard's Fee Assistance program helps make that care more affordable for families. Currently, 82% of Coast Guard children are enrolled in community-based child care. The Coast Guard is working...
title: Military Child Care: Coast Guard is Taking Steps to Increase Access for Families
